meanings.definition: Resembling a bud in appearance or growth.
meanings.sent1: The tiny flower was so budlike as it began to bloom.
meanings.sent2: The closed petals of the rose were budlike before opening fully.
meanings.sent3: The budlike shape of the balloon made it look like a small flower.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was budlike, ready to burst forth at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar's movement was slow and budlike, as if waiting to transform.

meanings.sent1: The young tree had a budlike growth at the tip of each branch.
meanings.sent2: The plant's leaves had a budlike texture, hinting at new growth.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's ears were so budlike, they seemed ready to sprout flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was budlike, always reaching out for new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The child's innocence was budlike, untouched by the harsh realities of the world.

meanings.definition: Having qualities similar to a bud.
meanings.sent1: The fabric had a budlike softness, gentle to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The cake had a budlike sweetness, just like a fresh flower.
meanings.sent3: His smile was budlike, spreading joy wherever he went.
meanings.sent4: The music was budlike, slowly unfurling its beauty to the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The morning mist was budlike, enveloping everything in a delicate embrace.
